summary.long: Jonah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jonah the son of Amittai saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise, go to Nineveh the great city and cry against it, for their wickedness has come up before Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord. So he went down to Joppa, found a ship which was going to Tarshish, paid the fare and went down into it to go with them to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord hurled a great wind on the sea and there was a great storm on the sea so that the ship was about to break up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sailors became afraid and every man cried to his god, and they threw the cargo which was in the ship into the sea to lighten it for them. But Jonah had gone below into the hold of the ship, lain down and fallen sound asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the captain approached him and said, “How is it that you are sleeping? Get up, call on your god. Perhaps your god will be concerned about us so that we will not perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each man said to his mate, “Come, let us cast lots so we may learn on whose account this calamity has struck us.” So they cast lots and the lot fell on Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Tell us, now! On whose account has this calamity struck us? What is your occupation? And where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I am a Hebrew, and I fear the Lord God of heaven who made the sea and the dry land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men became extremely frightened and they said to him, “How could you do this?” For the men knew that he was fleeing from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “What should we do to you that the sea may become calm for us?”—for the sea was becoming increasingly stormy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea. Then the sea will become calm for you, for I know that on account of me this great storm has come upon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the men rowed desperately to return to land but they could not, for the sea was becoming even stormier against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they called on the Lord and said, “We earnestly pray, O Lord, do not let us perish on account of this man’s life and do not put innocent blood on us; for You, O Lord, have done as You have pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they picked up Jonah, threw him into the sea, and the sea stopped its raging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men feared the Lord greatly, and they offered a sacrifice to the Lord and made vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord appointed a great fish to swallow Jonah, and Jonah was in the stomach of the fish three days and three nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonah prayed to the Lord his God from the stomach of the fish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he said,
“I called out of my distress to the Lord,
And He answered me.
I cried for help from the depth of Sheol;
You heard my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For You had cast me into the deep,
Into the heart of the seas,
And the current engulfed me.
All Your breakers and billows passed over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So I said, ‘I have been expelled from Your sight.
Nevertheless I will look again toward Your holy temple.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Water encompassed me to the point of death.
The great deep engulfed me,
Weeds were wrapped around my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I descended to the roots of the mountains.
The earth with its bars was around me forever,
But You have brought up my life from the pit, O Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“While I was fainting away,
I remembered the Lord,
And my prayer came to You,
Into Your holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Those who regard vain idols
Forsake their faithfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will sacrifice to You
With the voice of thanksgiving.
That which I have vowed I will pay.
Salvation is from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah up onto the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah the second time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise, go to Nineveh the great city and proclaim to it the proclamation which I am going to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jonah arose and went to Nineveh according to the word of the Lord. Now Nineveh was an exceedingly great city, a three days’ walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonah began to go through the city one day’s walk; and he cried out and said, “Yet forty days and Nineveh will be overthrown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Nineveh believed in God; and they called a fast and put on sackcloth from the greatest to the least of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the word reached the king of Nineveh, he arose from his throne, laid aside his robe from him, covered himself with sackcloth and sat on the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He issued a proclamation and it said, “In Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles: Do not let man, beast, herd, or flock taste a thing. Do not let them eat or drink water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But both man and beast must be covered with sackcloth; and let men call on God earnestly that each may turn from his wicked way and from the violence which is in his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who knows, God may turn and relent and withdraw His burning anger so that we will not perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When God saw their deeds, that they turned from their wicked way, then God relented concerning the calamity which He had declared He would bring upon them. And He did not do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it greatly displeased Jonah and he became angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He prayed to the Lord and said, “Please Lord, was not this what I said while I was still in my own country? Therefore in order to forestall this I fled to Tarshish, for I knew that You are a gracious and compassionate God, slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness, and one who relents concerning calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now, O Lord, please take my life from me, for death is better to me than life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Do you have good reason to be angry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jonah went out from the city and sat east of it. There he made a shelter for himself and sat under it in the shade until he could see what would happen in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord God appointed a plant and it grew up over Jonah to be a shade over his head to deliver him from his discomfort. And Jonah was extremely happy about the plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God appointed a worm when dawn came the next day and it attacked the plant and it withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun came up God appointed a scorching east wind, and the sun beat down on Jonah’s head so that he became faint and begged with all his soul to die, saying, “Death is better to me than life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Jonah, “Do you have good reason to be angry about the plant?” And he said, “I have good reason to be angry, even to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “You had compassion on the plant for which you did not work and which you did not cause to grow, which came up overnight and perished overnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should I not have compassion on Nineveh, the great city in which there are more than 120,000 persons who do not know the difference between their right and left hand, as well as many animals?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
